values:
It's been again a time since last i wrote. The seasons have turned and i find myself perilously close to the time of anniversaries that i had never counted on, and a year i thought i'd never reach. Of this writing i have successfully made it through the first week of being twenty-seven years of age. Being officially past my date of expiration, it seems as though it's time to live like it.

Victories have been won on the political front and on the personal. Work proceeds in ways that i had never though possible, as really marketing and my own self just seems like oil and water. But there we are. 

Spring is slowly creeping forward, as are my pretensions of being a professional artist, above and beyond the call of a mere designer. The shape of the 'Clyffe is going to be changing in the months to come. Which is exciting and new and different. The cleaning this year is going to be somewhat epic, given that there will be a giant dumpster. And into it will go our broken things, and musty afterthoughts. Probably Weenis's toys, but that rather goes without saying.

People have been coming in, more often than they've been leaving, which is thrilling and wonderful. Things remain warm and close, even in the growing world.

And so it is, i leave this entry with so much unsaid and so much to look forward to.

Happy New Years everyone. May it be all that you make of it.

There's something about cloudy days, when the world is damp and cool that leads one to musing. Moving back and forth across one's home, searching for remnants of the summer and the sweater you were certain you had shoved in a particular corner roughly six months ago. Autumn is well and truly upon us, and it seems as though it will be leading into a winter that will be a bit less harsh than others have been. Finally have a name to put to the "vapours", which comes as quite a relief, to be honest. There's stuff to do about it! A solid (and rather long) sort of name to put to it, and did i mention there are things i can do about it? Truly, it's a marvelous sort of thing. New leads have popped up on the art/design front, we'll be seeing how that pans out over the next few months. So much to remember to do, and so much fear to overcome. Oh my. For the first time in quite some time, i'll be out of the state for a Holiday. This may well end in fire, but then again, most of my endeavors have that sort of potential. Updates will occur when this becomes an actual thing, as opposed to something that is in the far future. Parties are being planned, among them a Hallowe'en party, and something that has been dubbed ElectionGate '08. That's right kids, show up at Wardenclyffe on election day and drink your concern over the future of The State away. Wee and ha. Speaking of moving back and forth, i really ought get back to it. Happy autumn, all.

Amidst the cleaning, the editing, the cat chasing and other activities to the day, it would seem i slipped back into the habit of acquiring catchy but (at the least) melancholy tunage. Which, given my current elcetro-pop tendencies, is a bit bemusing. Though, now having looked over my music library, really oughtn't surprise me over-much. Buggery.

Regardless, the new Ben Folds/Regina Spektor song is terribly catchy and will likely be in regular rotation for the next few weeks. Which means it's time to dig Piibo out of the car. And pop on Death Cab For Cutie's cover of This Charming Man, while i'm thinking on it. Which is something that i ought have already had on (or in it?) it already, but sadly is not.

Shit, i need to go on a Morrissey binge now.

It seems that July passed by in a haze of running around, naps in the sun and calls that i forgot to make. Oh oh! And work, days filled with bits of coding and designs that are cleaner than anything i'd choose to use for my own self.

GenCon is next week, with all the attendant madness that one could expect. As i type this there are parts of my brain screaming, "STOP THE MADNESS OF WORDS AND GET BACK TO THE PICTURE MAKING" which is really something that i ought be doing. And so it is, to the coffee pot and the drawing table i go, likely popping on to edit this over the course of the day.

We find ourselves in June, or perhaps the remnants of April that were kindly packed up and sent to the here and now by someone who thought themselves to be providing some sort of service. It is, a such, that leaves a body at odd ends, puttering and looking through boxes wondering what to make of articles of the past.

This beats taking up a habit, i'm told.

Much of the entirety of everyone will be here by Friday, which will make this Solstice perhaps the best one ever. Certainly the best in recent years.

Leading a professional sort of life remains to be frightening, but less and less of it shows each day. Mayhap someday i will be able to bluff as though it were never there to begin with! Haha! As if.

What are the rest of you folks about this summer? What are you reading, doing and/or planning? Are you taking up piano lessons, or perhaps going out and conducting swimming races with selkies? Let me know! i am curious!

There was something else that i had really wanted to ask, but we'll have to make due with the above for the time being.

Never thought that i'd find the letter "T" to be much in the way of ominous, but there you have it.

To-day is a day for fevered working out, puzzling over code, and copious amounts of vicodin. Oh, and plotting out bits of the Sunday game, as nothing says quality like pain meds, right?

The weather is perfect and i think i'll attempt to talk Heather into putting up with me in it. All this nervous energy needs to go -somewhere- and i can't really swallow my fears like i used to when i was younger.

In other news, it looks like a good third of the people i know will be attending Gen Con this year, and as such, i believe some mild planning might be called for. Really, what this works out to, is in the evening we all need to get together and find an entertaining way of going about and tearing up the town. Any suggestions?

It's one thing i never thought i'd find myself doing, but it seems to be a habit i've been slipping into in my old age. Whereas in the long ago times, there would be over the top, blown out well, blown out everything, it's reached a point where much of the world is getting downplayed. At least, in the near constant narrative that my mind runs as i go about the business of living and doing.

This follows along with the disconcerting notion that i've gone a bit adrift of my emotions. They're there, but it's like someone else is living them, and i'm only getting relays via semaphore much of the time. Which, while is makes for an interesting mental image, is less than fun to be living through.

And so it is, that i've come upon the conclusion that this will be the summer of the up and out. Dancing in the living room regardless of who may be home, making large gestures for the sheer joy of being able to do so, getting back into the habit of sprawling out and painting in nothing but a sports bra and bifurcated garment that ostensibly goes on below the waist. This might well include items such as pants, or shorts.

The summer is for doing and living, and that involves experiencing things dammit. It's time for recalling that winter's over and it's all right to traipse about barefoot and dreaming again.

Time to get a drink and get -on- that shit.

This is meme-theft on multiple levels, though the primary source (as it is in most things) is Kyla.

1) Using band names (AND MUSICIANS), spell out your name.
L - LCD Soundsystem
I - Idlewild
A - Aphex Twin

2) Have you ever had a song written about you?
Yes, and it was mopey as all get out. This is what happens when you date goths.

3) What songs make you cry?
"The Blower's Daughter" by Damien Rice, the sang makes me think of the movie "Closer" and then i just go to pieces. Loreena McKennitt's rendition of "The Lady of Shalott" gets me as well.

4) What songs make you happy?
Just about anything by Hellogoodbye or Great Big Sea, they're both passing brilliant for feeling giddy and bouncing around. Death Cab's cover of "This Charming Man" makes me squee quite a bit as well.

5) What do you like to listen to before bed?
Classical music when i remember that i actually have a functioning radio. Most of the time it is simply the sounds of fans and slowly realised dreams.

There had been plans for this to be a day in which i woke up at an hour that is at least vaguely reasonable to people who do the 9 to 5 grind, but that sort of fell through. As such, i woke up around noon, cursing various deities and the children at the local elementary school. Obviously, the little punters aren't properly sugared up, and as such were unable to wake me up in a timely fashion. Well, wake me up again. i had gotten up at nine-something-or-other, and snuggled back up with the intent to sleep another ten minutes. This was, obviously, not as successful as hoped.

On the other hand, i am well rested for the first time in a couple weeks, which is a nice change of pace.

The day is cycling between sunny and bright, and the world being remarkably without direct sunlight even though the vast majority of the sky is clear clear blue. This makes for some interesting shifts in motivation and energy levels. Hopefully, this won't get in the way of lawn mowing and the attendant puttering around the lawn. There are likely balls, frisbees and childish hopes and dreams that i need to throw back over the fence.

Everyone has been making requests for books, music and video games appropriate to the season, and not to be left behind i think i'll be making a request of my own. Given that there's going to be some traveling done with other humans in my company i find myself in need of ways to keep myself and others entertained while in a car/train/super-sonic dirigible. So, suggestions? This also extends to games to play in the yard, or at a park. As i think that as this stage in our lives Red Rover could become a bit more dangerous than it ever got in choir.

Which is saying something, really.

Traverse City is this weekend, as well as DEMF. Both of which promise to be fun and exhausting, which is really the right and proper way to put a cap on Spring.

Next week: Filler episodes and discussion of the current research topic.

There's a point after i get off the phone with a parental unit in which i find myself staring bemusedly at the phone wondering when the hell it was that i stopped being a self-centred shit and became someone who doesn't completely blow arse-fez. Regardless of the when, i'm laying the onus of this shift at the feet of Jen and Scott; gods know they deserve all the credit and kudos i can toss their way. ...And pie, they likely deserve pie or maybe cake. To-day is another DAY OF INDUSTRY and as such, i have VNV Nation on endless loop (Chrome, from Matter + Form, for those who are interested) which is a fine thing. i'd say that i'll be popping up a discussion point, or elaborating on what i've been reading/writing about of late, but we all know at this point that i'll likely be distracted due to running out into the world, or squirrels or some shiny (why the hell doesn't shiny still have an 'e' in it?) device of Hippy-like origin. And with that in mind, i bid you all good day. And what a fine day it is.

Why oh why self, do you think it's a good idea to listen to -mopey- Morrissey directly after waking up?

You arse-fez.

EDIT: Don't think listening to mid-90s dance anthems makes up for this.

There are likely things that i could have been doing this afternoon. Like walking down to the park, procrastinating on mowing the lawn, playing with hedge-clippers (who doesn't want to play with hedge-clippers?), and other things that would have been of use. But once i got home, all notions of that sort of thing were put aside in favor of taking a nap with the cat. She takes up the entirety of my torso! It is -amazing-. But all of this laziness stems from having a really excellent (if not very long) time last night. i forgot words! There was toast! And the projector that would not focus. o.o This might be because the projector operator was a zombie. At least, i am thinking he might have been a zombie. i didn't look, what with the sensible fear that pink dye saturated brains are somewhat of a delicacy amongst the un-dead. The thing about hanging out with new people, especially when you are without the company of your tried-and-true people, is that you can keenly feel the fact that you are likely kinda different than you were the last time you gave yourself an internal once over. And this can be a strange sort of thing that causes a body to become tongue tied and oddly uncertain in the face of what would be a normal sort of interaction. Leaves one feeling strange and new and mutable in a certain, rather giddy, sort of way. This is not conducive to learning new dance steps, in case anyone was wondering. To-morrow there will be a trip to the beach. Or, barring that, we will hang out at Chanson's and drink in the hot-tub until it seems like it's just as good as going to the beach GO SEE IRON MAN AND HAVE A RUNNING NERF BATTLE, YEAH! Also, my father is turning fifty-six. Which is honestly much more frightening than the fact that i turned twenty-six. Dads aren't supposed to get old, you see, they are just supposed to get grey at the edges and somehow grow both more curmudgeonly and kindly forever and ever, amen. It is still today though, and there are things that i should likely get on about. Like rocking out to the mix-tape that drives everyone else nuts. HAHA! Victory for the one who is home by herself! There is also that business of getting art-work done during said rocking out, and getting laundry done among other things. Which is what i believe i shall be about.

Jess tagged me with this t'other day (read: sometime last week) so it seems like now is a good time to do this meme thing. Gods know i'm not good for aught else right now. Days after clubbing rock socks, sirs and ladies. List seven songs you are into right now. No matter what the genre, whether they have words, or even if they're not any good, but they must be songs you're really enjoying now, shaping your spring. Post these instructions in your LJ along with your 7 songs. Then tag 7 other people to see what they're listening to. 1) Someone Great - LCD Soundsystem 2) Ordinary Day - Great Big Sea 3) Let's Dance to Joy Division - The Wombats (any band that involves a marsupial in its name is automatically cooler than cool. trufax) 4) Oxford Comma - Vampire Weekend 5) See and Be Scene - The Hard Lessons 6) Flux - Bloc Party 7) Only This Moment Royskopp As far as tagging goes, i choose: Jen! Brian! Joe! (all hojillion of you) Raini! Luna! The good Doctor Vekk! and the inimitable Kyla-Kyla! What have we learned from this collection of music? That i am a slut for up-tempo music and songs that go boop. Really, the album The Point by Henry Nilsson should be on that list as well. It is good comfort music and a very good story. Go and get yourself a copy if you don't already own it. In real news, we close on the house tomorrow. Wish us luck kids.

What is it about warm weather and the prospect of pool crashing that makes life seem that much better? Damned if i know, but hell if i'll not be taking advantage of it. In other news, i have re-found the Red Velvet Jesus Head. This is likely good, as the spider seems to come around with less frequency when it's on the desk. Theoretically, i get paid this week. That would be is awesome. i think i will be going down to the lake and looking at minnows to-day. Maybe i'll encounter another mini-quest. That last one was pretty easy. Edit: Yay monies, slight o.O at being able to pull my hair back into a tiny pony knub.
Tomorrow, Scott and i are doing that marriage thinger-bobble.

Kids who live in places that are not Michigan-Town (the mighty nation that subsumed Cake Town in the long ago times), have an urge to see a Lia? If you do, look for cons in your area that have artist alleys or a similar sort of venue. 

THIS IS THE YEAR WE GET PROFESSIONAL, BAY-BEE.

And as such, i really should do that thing where i get around and show off my stuff.

So, anyone got a couch/con? :3?

i feel like such an arse-fez. The only upshot to this? i am a well medicated arse-fez.

Menstruation is the pits .__.

One learns, after time and much trial, that perhaps it is not the best of ideas to reacquaint oneself with stories much favoured and beloved at times such as three in the morning. This might (though it is not guaranteed) lead one to read until about five in the morning. By which time one gets the notion that it's currently too bright to be sleeping and that really, isn't it a better thing to be on the internets, typing out an LJ post?

Now, while it is generally accepted that one not stay up 'til five in the morning, and one when does it is best that one's thoughts remain one's own and not blogged about.


But really, i hardly exhibit that much sense when i'm fully rested, so sod the notion that what i'm writing now makes any less sense than the rest of it.

This is the portion of the post where we ignore the current discussion of coprophagia, kitten armies and chinchillas. Really, it's better for all of us that way.


The following post has been brought to you by: Jen's laptop, AIM, wikipedia, Kittens, Josh, Cordwainer Smith, and the distinction between Sci-Fi and Science Fiction.

It's been a time. There is good news (hooray new clients). There is bad news (gran was in the hospital, doesn't look like anyone plans on her surviving subsequent visits). And then there is the rest of everything else. Which is a lot. Like, a lot a lot. All of this happening and doing has been accompanied by the strangeness of getting myself into a groove in which things actually get done! Like, in a timely fashion and everything. For those who know me, this is quite obviously a very strange thing. Strange like kittens making you organic, vegan pancakes and then regaling you with their (rather erudite) musings on aesthetics. There have also been books, lots and lots of rather good books (and a couple atrocious ones) both genre-fiction and non. It might be prudent to make a second posting distinctly on what i've been reading and things that i have been thinking and discussing because said reading. That, and i really should see to this whole eating business before this working out thing happens. i hear it's what all the cool kids are about these days. Damn, is it a time.

Of being irked. Have to re-install CS3 and all my brushes. Oh, and i can't use either of my scanners, as the companies are too busy sucking Vista cock to say PUT OUT DRIVERS FOR MAC 10.5. Nevermind that the drivers Lexmark currently has up makes it so a body can't open up Photoshop CS3. At all. It simply stops and crashes. Man i miss the days when Windoze boxes were just for spreadsheets and killing mans. On the upshot, the giant Appa(s) arrived to-day! He is so big! Like, bigger than my torso! Note the wee Appa peering in the door. :3 Wee Appa has joined his big friend! Scott has them too! Huzzah! Truly, plushies will save us all.

No really, it's not universe, despite your vociferous protests to the contrary. Now, if you would be so kinda, knock that the fuck out. In other news, i have learned many things this week! Such as the fact that there are really scary looking Margaret Atwood signing machines. There is also the fact that there is nothing more terrifyingly funny than fuzzily recalled teevee programming from one's youth. Case in point? THE FLYING HOUSE, BITCHES. There's much to say, but the words won't come.
New hair! Though this picture really doesn't do it any justice. When it's not ass-bitingly cold, i'll get a better shot of it.

It's been a time since i've posted, but something substantial can likely wait until Tuesday when my mind/brain is organised for such things. Until then, have this quiz thinger i ganked from a couple people.

To-day, i have found what i believe to be the best thing about largely conducting one's affairs from home. And that would be taking advantage of those scant hours in the day when there's no-one about. And so it was, with great relish, that i wound up taking a shower with the door open, having set the radio on top of the laundry hamper. There was singing, and dancing, and a lot of water. Somewhere during the process, i managed to get clean as well.

This made up for a morning that was a bit more scary than i thought it would be. There's nothing quite like leaping up out of sleep to answer the phone and once that business is conducted, watch the world grow dim around you. It was a mauve sort of dim too, no notion as to what that might mean though.

Perhaps it means the Mary Kay armies seek my blood, the better to rejuvenate creepy, elderly, mid-western hostesses or some-such.

And now, back to work!

Zug zug, and all that.

We watched Paprika last night. It was as delightfully vibrant and surreal as the other films that the creative team has put out. The soundtrack is something that i require, and as such will be seeking out shortly. Unsurprisingly, i found myself identifying with the dream girl. Par for the course. Sicko was also part of the day, and it was more or less what i expected it to be. Though it was fun in the special features, watching the various talking heads completely denouncing the possibility that other country's medical systems could be even half so nice as they were portrayed as in the movie. Which is, as i understand it, just about what most people see their socialised medical programs as. Flawed systems, but certainly better than leaving it in private hands for the most part. Five weeks of paid vacation a year and a thirty-five hour work week sound utterly divine, and i think the attitude that such things are beneficial to society at all levels is something that needs to be incorporated into the American mindset. Though this will like never happen, and really what the hell do i know? i'm just a slack-ass artist cum intellectual and a godless-commie-heathen to boot. Nevermind the fact that godless heathen is an oxymoron. If anyone can hook me up with a copy of "When Will Then Be Now?" (a cover album of The Smiths tunes) i would love them forever and ever, unto the heat death of the universe. Part of the day's proceedings shall involve calling around in the hopes of finding mental health care on the cheap. Should anyone have any suggestions as to where a body might call about such things, it would be greatly appreciated. Update: Appointment has been made for one o'clock on Monday at the women's centre in Lansing. i am slightly afeared. The only constant will be change, dammit.
What the hell was i doing with myself when i didn't have VNV Nation in my playlist? Fuck, i don't know. More will come later, now is INDUSTRY!

To-day and the previous day have been very busy! With running around, and talking with humans, grocery shopping, trying to get my scanner to work (again), and much else besides. It's been a good sort of busy though, full of productivity and happy things.

Plans for Yulemas go apace, and while the computer related bits are running more slowly than i'd like they're still moving ahead.

For some reason, i seem to have formed the mental connection that jingly pants or plaid skirts equal productivity. It seems i'll have to be getting more in the way of warm tights and legwarmers to accommodate this trend. Certainly not a bad thing though, i should think. Especially since none of my "short" skirts are any shorter than just above the knee. Such is life, i suppose.

On to thing that are of important to one Jess (and other who might be attendant to this sort of madness): i'm getting a list of conventions and their attendant art spaces around. We ought plan FOR CONQUERING and great justice.

i actually finished the art-work for the Wardenclyffe Yulemas missive, and will be seeing to its publication on Sunday, more like than not.

Still need to get out and dance more, dammit.

i am making the motion to declare to-day Sunday 1.5, on the basis of only getting something like an hour and a half of solid sleep last night. As we all know, it's not really the next day until one gets at least a good four hours of sleep into a body.

On the health related front, i apparently have an irregular heartbeat, but it's not consistent, and "nothing to worry about". Given that it took over a month to receive this news, and the fact that i had to call for it, you'll have to excuse me if i'm a bit unconvinced oh Dr and attendant office drones.

Got a lot to do to-day, but i'm fair confident that it can get done with a minimum of swearing and running about in a tizzy. After all, i have A List. i am -organised-. Tremble ye mighty, and despair.

Who know, i might even go outside today. What a wonder that would be.

You know it's almost 4 in the morning when you begin to start searching for deep meaning in happy hard-core songs. It is also a sign that one might want to get some more coffee, and quickly.

Though, this might be a mistake.


i'll inform you all of the outcome of this choice of caffeine later.

Happy December to all and sundry!

This year has gone by so bloody fast, it's sort of hard to believe. There's so much to say about all that's happened, and all the hopes for the not now. Damned if i can get anything set into anything that looks like prose and not the transcribed ramblings of a high and sapient squirrel.

Suffice it to say, it's a fine night tonight, and it's going to be a fine day tomorrow.

There are some of you who will see the time stamp on this entry, who might perhaps think, "Oh, look at Lia. Being all grown-up and getting up at a reasonable hour." You lot can all go sod off.

Why yes, it is that certain time of the month that all girls love, and damn are the cramps exquisite this time around. Which leaves me huddled around a heating pad, waiting for the pain killers to hit ad editing photos for work. Nevermind that i also checked my auctions in WoW. 

Shortly, i will toddle off to the shower. Hopefully i'll remember that i oughtn't take the heating pad with me.

There will be a post full of non-bitching later in the day.

It has been brought to my attention (several times in fact) that this year marks the fourth holiday season that i and assorted others will be celebrating at the People's Republic of Wardenclyffe. Damn odd it is, to think that we've been at the house for so long, but there it is.

Thankshousing and the week leading up to it was well up to cavalcade standards, and whimsy was present in large amounts; this is as it ought be. Needless to say, there is so much in the way of thanks given to the occupants of Wardenclyffe, the rest of the celebrants and the family members who have roamed far afield (or had to work, damn holiday sales and the like). Without you lot, there would be precious little to celebrate.

Normally, this is where i would be regaling you with tales of fun and games on the medical front, but sadly there's nothing new to report. This is in large part due to my doctor's office being incredibly inept at doing things such as calling me, and the desk staff being seemingly made of half baked thoughts and straw, and as such being singularly unhelpful. Educated mud indeed.

i've been giving thought to the nature of adulthood, though there's precious little that coherent enough to put to paper (as it were). Once i get something though, expect some rambling to such ends. 

There will be updates on both business and art later on in the week, rambling on the latter will largely go as thus: "LDKFRTJlksejakthAKLSDFHqw;jfkhtgslkgjdzkfjf I FINALLY HAVE SOMETHING UP BWAHAHAHAHAHAAAAAA!!!! OM NOM NOM" with rolling and frothing following shortly afterwards.

It is too cold to be wearing short skirts, but damned if i know of a better way to get my plaid fix.

Now, it is time for work.

i'm in Texas for the second time this year. Though i find myself half convinced that we entered into some temporal gateway while driving on I35, and Austin is in some sort of alternate dimension that only has loose ties with Texas in the world as we know it.

The hotel room is nice, with a big bed and a collection of pillows that are slowly turning pink. There is also a pool, and a never-ending supply of coffee.

Life is good.

In the name of keeping those of you who are in Intarweb-land updated on the state of the Sprelx, i come bearing news.

No longer acting entirely as a freelance entity, i have found employment with a certain book-shop in the EL area. It might also be safe to assume that given the fact that i've been employed by three different organisations to do this sort of business, that i might be something of a budding webmaster. Who'd have thought?

Things with the art proceed apace, getting bogged down with a touch of dialogue and some self-doubt. But drinking more sugar water and stomping some arrows ought alleviate at least one of those issues.

Autumn is still the season of reminiscence, though this year there's less in the way of melancholy. Hell, there's been less in the way of moods and fugues all around, which has been delightful in so many ways.

On the medical front, i had a halter monitor on earlier in the week. It was rather entertaining as it gave the appearance of Chthonic tentacles; fun for the whole family. Not entirely certain when the results will be coming in from that, but i think that there will have been some decent data garnered. As really, if i'm going to turn grey while working out, it might as well be in the name of science.

Last night in the shower i had some interesting reflections on the nature and necessity of language, but unfortunately all such thoughts left when i started to towel off. Instead, i offer up a meme that was tossed my way by the ever delightful Miss Jessy (one of our Pokanadians)

<lj-cut text="i think it's funny because it all comes in threes">
THREE THINGS YOU WANT TO DO BEFORE YOU DIE:
1. Sleep on a beach again
2. Get published
3. Travel more

THREE NAMES YOU GO BY:
1) Lia
2) Sprelx
3) She who rises from the depths bearing madness in her wake and demanding coffee with milk and some sugar, please.

THREE SCREEN NAMES YOU HAVE HAD:
1) dancer newold
2) Lia
3) Numinous Intent

THREE PHYSICAL THINGS YOU LIKE ABOUT YOURSELF:
1) My hair, it keeps my head warm
2) The weird bump on my ankle left over from the surgery
3) My tendency to build muscle mass quickly

THREE PARTS OF YOUR HERITAGE:
1) Irish
2) Scottish
3) English

THREE THINGS THAT SCARE YOU:
1) The thought of not being able to move
2) Spiders
3) What i must assume are the usual thoughts that everyone has in relation to their personal relationship with entropy and how it relates to their life and times.

THREE OF YOUR EVERYDAY ESSENTIALS:
1) Toast
2) Hugs not bugs
3) Bouncing

THREE THINGS YOU ARE WEARING RIGHT NOW:
1) Argyle socks (they are pink!)
2) oversized boy shorts
3) A hoodie with the SCAD Bees logo

THREE OF YOUR FAVORITE BANDS/MUSICAL ARTISTS:
1) R.E.M.
2) Bad Religion
3) VNV Nation

THREE OF YOUR FAVORITE SONGS:
1) "Orange Crush" - R.E.M.
2) "Ana Ng" - They Might Be Giants
3) "Everything Is Alright" Motion City Soundtrack

THREE THINGS YOU WANT IN A RELATIONSHIP:
1) An attitude which promotes the discussion of ideas
2) Willingness to work at and accept differences (i like Jessy's answer, and i am lazy)
3) Storytelling

TWO TRUTHS AND A LIE (in no particular order):
1) Even though i no longer read her work i have a deep and abiding love of Anne McCaffrey's books
2) For a time, i was obnoxiously Pentecostal
3) When i hang up the phone, or close a chat window, i wave as i say/type my goodbyes

THREE PHYSICAL THINGS ABOUT THE PREFERRED SEX(ES) THAT APPEAL TO YOU:
1) Long hair

In the name of passing this on, i tag Brian, Jen and Heather

It is terribly amusing to me, that while i am generally decent with modern technology and its various proclivities i have to settle down and write things out by hand, lest i come off sounding like an utter retard. There's just something about having a writing instrument in hand, scratching ideas out and getting things all in a jumble as one's thoughts are moving faster than one's hand. Or hands, if a body is inclined to ambidexterity. ...And writing with both hands at once.

On the topic of other things less amusing, the blood tests of last week turned up exactly dick nor shit. Which is about what i had expected, but had been hoping for something else. Such is life though, and it means that there will be further adventures in the land of medical testing. Which likely sounds more fun than it will wind up being.

i believe that i shall endeavor to steal as many latex gloves and giant swabby things as i possibly can. It seems like a decent enough goal to have.

My pants are jingly today, which brings much joy and somehow convinces me that i am a Real Girl who is capable of writing things that would entice people to hire me. Also, the pink shirt with drunken kitties on it. As everyone knows, drunk kitties are the epitome of professionalism.

This is one of the very few times that i've ever been nervous about going to the doctor's office. 

Huh.

i'll keep updating this as info comes in, i do believe. It certainly beats writing the 10,000 mini entries. Which is very similar to the 10,000 things of Taoism, and not very much like 10,000 Maniacs at all.

Edit the first
Well, so far, there's no particular notion as to what could be wrong. An initial check-up came up with zilch in the way of evidence for the issue being neurological. Which is something of a weight off my mind (haha, i know, i am clevar).

Five separate blood tests will be run, off of three rather large tubes of blood. Unfortunately, i passed out during the proceedings and nearly slid out of the seat. Admittedly, it would have likely looked hilarious to a passerby.

Next on the agenda: calling the insurance company to see what they'll cover by way of MRI scans and the like. Whee~!

For all i find wonder and interest in the human condition, it often leaves a body bemused and feeling out of sorts.

Also leaving one out of sorts, is a consistent bout of having micro blackouts. Which make for annoying times, but at least i can laugh about it. 

Things with artwork move ahead at a pleasing pace, though i have recently been thwarted in the area of uploading things. There will be the calling of the hosting provider, and sense will be made.

To-day was officially too hot for even me. It's been some time since i've regretted wearing a black t-shirt. This business with October being July-redux is bunk, if you ask me. i demand my chilly days that are good for sweaters and snuggling and leaves turning colour. As such things are of great import.

Words thoughts and dreams go here.

To date, these are the things i have found in the couch:

2 shirts (one long-sleeved, one short sleeved)
3 pens
1 non-photo blue pencil
3 remotes
1 sock
6 pieces of Nerds candy
7 receipts
1 No Means No album

and one laminated rules list for Warhammer 40K.

My, the couch is full of many things.

To-day is very much one of those unreal days that have a tendency of following a weekend in which one has a very excellent time, but the suspicion that one is about to step off and into the aether is a very real sort of thing. While this isn't a bad stepping off, it's one of those moments when you realise that things are at a point in which one needs to make a choice and then do something about it.

As i set here typing, i find myself thinking about watercolours, and whether i have the right type of salt to achieve the effect that i have in mind (i never have the salt i'm looking for, mind you). There are also vague thoughts on what i've been listening to of late, and what that says about me as a person. When we die, are we judged by our "most played" lists from iTunes? More likely than one would think! <strike>As though weighing heart feathers made any more sense</strike>

It is Autumn now, though it feels like it should still be summer. But then, i belive it should always be the beginning of summer, with clear skies giving way to afternoon thuderstorms and puddle stomping. Where the days are forever getting longer and there is the thought of going out in the evening to swim in a body of water that is never yours.

So to-day is a day of realised possibility. i'm going to finish that code and the watermark. Find the salt that i need and take a turn at dancing with arrows.

It is a fine day.

You know you're in the right when i librarian thinks that your being fired is "disgusting". 

i am so bringing her and the rest of her co-workers brownies.

The trip to Boston was full of win and people that i just met, but seemed as though they were old friends. As per normal, i have an urge to pack up, and run away to the East Coast, this time to bartend and do art. 

There will be more notes on this when i'm less frazzled, and the world seems to be a more stable place. But, suffice it to say, things are more or less all right, and everything that's not right can be fixed.

So, as to plans and other things.

Next week i'll be out in Boston, coming back to Wardenclyffe on the following Wednesday in the early early hours (why i thin ki can manage to navigate airport terminals at 6 in the morning is beyond me). There will be catching Great Big Sea, i think. Joe of the east coast, is this still the case?? :O?? I MUST KNOW. Mostly for the purpose of how many people are going and whether or not i ought rent a car.

The weekend after that it looks like i'll be heading out to Gen Con for the purpose of schlepping my shit to hung-over members of the RPG publishing world. 

. . .

I might also find it in me to chew out someone at White Wolf about 4th ed. Changeling. *clears throat*

Just have to get some coding done, and the website will be up. Now constitutes the portion of the evening where it seems vaguely plausible that i might be something approaching professional.

There's really so much more that i'd like to say, but my head is so much a happy muddle at the moment. And really, it's been that way for a while. Fuck, summer rocks.
Oh good gods, i have PLANS. Or rather, plans in potentia, but dammit, it's closer than i usually get. . . . Stay tuned for further updates.
So, i don't really say things like this very often, but good gods Ann Coulter is a cunt.
